alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, south central Jackson and northwestern Clay Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hazel Patch, or 8 miles northwest of London, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lamero, Templer and Cruise around 455 PM EDT. East Bernstadt, Carmichael and Mershons around 500 PM EDT. London, Victory, Pittsburg and Eberle around 505 PM EDT. Atlanta and Peoples around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Greenmount, Cornelius, Mcwhorter, Maplesville, Moores Creek, Langnau, Green Hill, Crawford, Portersburg, Benge, Fogertown, Deer Lick, Byron, Royrader, Grace, Datha and Urban. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
